{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3555740,"name":"9016a","username":"Mehmet1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mehmet1/{size}/238645_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T01:58:31.715Z","cooked":"

It’s been on my mind for a while now, but I haven’t found a reliable method yet.

Many teams use vision-based pose estimation for autonomous pathing and precise Reef Alignment, and my team is working toward the same goal. However, one of the biggest challenges we face is calibrating to each specific competition field.

The Calibration Problem

In our code, we define 12 poses per alliance, corresponding to each scoring position on the reef. I can calculate the ideal poses mathematically—determining where the robot should align for each stick of the reef. However, we’ve found that these poses need to be tuned for every field due to inevitable variations in reef stick placement, apriltag positioning, and other small inconsistencies. Given the tight tolerances required for reef scoring, we need a robust approach to handle these discrepancies.

My Current Approaches

  1. Theoretical Pose Calculation
  • I start by determining the pose of the robot if it were fully lined up to the reef (bumpers touching).
  • I obtain this pose from Choreo by manually placing the robot against the reef.
  • From there, I apply an offset backward to find the scoring position.However, this approach assumes near-perfect conditions—accurate robot-to-camera offsets, precise apriltag placement, and a field that closely matches the model. Any small variation could throw off alignment.
  1. On-the-Fly Calibration (Saving “Successful” Poses)
  • During a match, I manually align and score an L4 coral.
  • I click a button to save the current pose as a reference.
  • I then attempt to use auto-align with the saved pose for L3 or L2 to verify its reliability.The problem? Quite often, this “confirmation stage” fails—the pose doesn’t work as expected, causing missed corals and confusion.

Seeking a Better Method

These approaches have their flaws, and I’d love to hear feedback on better strategies for tuning auto-align poses on practice day (Thursday). How do other teams approach this problem? What’s the most reliable way to generate poses that actually work in competition?

Vision Pose Estimation Issue

Another problem I’ve noticed, both on practice fields and at official events (e.g., Hudson Valley Regional), is instability in Vision pose estimation when close to the reef apriltags (within <1m).

  • The estimated pose jumps around unpredictably, sometimes shifting the overall position by more than 5cm.
  • Since the pose estimator’s standard deviation is very low at close range, these sudden changes confuse the auto-align algorithm, causing the robot to move in circles (since its tolerance is 1cm).

To mitigate this, I’ve tried rejecting vision updates when the camera is closer than 0.8m to the apriltag, but this often results in misalignment when scoring corals.

Has anyone else encountered this issue? Would additional filtering for Vision help stabilize the estimate? I would love any insight anyone would have!

FYI we use a Limelight 3G and a Limelight 3 for global pose estimation with MT1 and MT2. We use AdvantageKit’s Vision template with further filtering included as well (always trying to avoid “Garbage in, garbage out”).

As always, feel free to elaborate on technical stuff and yap, I’m trying to learn all I can

One thing I’ve found that helps with aligning rotation-wise is setting your desired pose to be slightly inside of whatever you’re aligning to make sure your bumpers end up flush. WPIcal can help with determining where the AprilTags are placed on the real field, but it wouldn’t solve the alignment circles problem. Not sure if it would be easy to switch before your next event, but teams have had success in the past running PhotonVision on their limelights, so that could be something to test.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T12:31:20.983Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":333,"readers_count":332,"score":96.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":495387,"topic_slug":"teams-how-do-you-tune-auto-align-and-vision-to-competition-fields-particularly-for-reef-alignment","display_username":"Micah","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":59402,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1710 Alum"},"post_url":"/t/teams-how-do-you-tune-auto-align-and-vision-to-competition-fields-particularly-for-reef-alignment/495387/2","custom_user_title":"1710 Alum","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556027,"name":"Steven Carmain","username":"Steven_Carmain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/f07891/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T13:21:59.195Z","cooked":"

We use PhotonVision and PathPlanner with YAGSL, and the trick we found… Don’t trust either.

PhotonVision (really pose estimation) starts to fail when the field shifts throughout the event. We found that turning off our back camera while pole aligning made a big difference. In theory, WpiCal could help also, but we haven’t touched the tool yet.

Also, PathPlanner struggles with getting to an exact point. It will get you close, and then finish (no definite number, it’s based on your max accel, we found roughly 6”). After PathPlanner finishes, we run a fine adjust command (just PID in the X, Y, and rotation), and it gets us spot on the poles.

We had a 100% success rate at our first event with those tweaks and got the autonomous award with just a 2 piece auto. (We averaged 7 points/match higher auto average than the field)

Steven_Carmain:

turning off our back camera while pole aligning made a big difference

So… Turn off vision when you’re close to the reef?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T13:57:24.316Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":251,"readers_count":250,"score":65.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495387,"topic_slug":"teams-how-do-you-tune-auto-align-and-vision-to-competition-fields-particularly-for-reef-alignment","display_username":"9016a","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64852,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/teams-how-do-you-tune-auto-align-and-vision-to-competition-fields-particularly-for-reef-alignment/495387/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556101,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T15:06:17.563Z","cooked":"
Mehmet1:

Turn off vision when you’re close to the reef?

Yikes! I hope not. We assume turn off cameras that could see any tag other than the one we are aiming for. We decided to move our cameras so they both would see only the one reef tag we want as we get close.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T15:06:17.563Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":221,"readers_count":220,"score":44.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495387,"topic_slug":"teams-how-do-you-tune-auto-align-and-vision-to-competition-fields-particularly-for-reef-alignment","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/teams-how-do-you-tune-auto-align-and-vision-to-competition-fields-particularly-for-reef-alignment/495387/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556141,"name":"Steven Carmain","username":"Steven_Carmain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/f07891/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T15:47:09.421Z","cooked":"

Our issue is with multiple camera estimation, having field elements move over time causes the estimations move. We were throwing off our vision 2”+ because it kept finding the processor while our reef moved.

Focusing vision on the tag you are interested in (the pole tag) makes a big difference for aiming, since you don’t care on the field where the absolute location of the reef is anymore, you care where the pole location is relative to the tag.

I actually saw in the OP post and thought it was interesting that they found was the AprilTags were unstable very close (<1m), so they actually turn off the cameras close to the tags. On our robot, we put on handles that also cover the camera at some times (especially close), so I accidentally might have done this too. By just trusting wheel odometry the last 18” to the pole with no vision might be more trustworthy than the close tag accuracy.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T15:53:49.729Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":65.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":495387,"topic_slug":"teams-how-do-you-tune-auto-align-and-vision-to-competition-fields-particularly-for-reef-alignment","display_username":"Steven Carmain","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":64852,"username":"Mehmet1","name":"9016a","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/mehmet1/{size}/238645_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1737,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer/Drive Coach"},"post_url":"/t/teams-how-do-you-tune-auto-align-and-vision-to-competition-fields-particularly-for-reef-alignment/495387/6","custom_user_title":"Programmer/Drive Coach","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556159,"name":"","username":"aspen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/aspen/{size}/258678_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T16:00:05.151Z","cooked":"

fwiw i’ve heard that there’s been a lot of variation this year in placement precision for barge + human player tags. take this with a grain of salt, since we also had some issues with camera focus, but for our later matches at ocr we turned off the back cameras that would be looking at those tags while scoring and saw some improvements. we’re currently also working on better filtering

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T16:00:05.151Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":178,"readers_count":177,"score":60.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":495387,"topic_slug":"teams-how-do-you-tune-auto-align-and-vision-to-competition-fields-particularly-for-reef-alignment","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58585,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8033 | vice captain"},"post_url":"/t/teams-how-do-you-tune-auto-align-and-vision-to-competition-fields-particularly-for-reef-alignment/495387/7","custom_user_title":"8033 | vice captain","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556190,"name":"Owen Busler","username":"Owen_Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T16:34:09.668Z","cooked":"

8513 is doing almost the exact same thing. Only update our pose with tags which are attached to the place we are going (If we are going TO the reef, we use reef tags, if we are going TO the processor, we use the processor tags). Once we pathfind to within 18 inches, we “attackPoint” (Profiled PID in the XY and rotation) to the exact pose.

This worked quite well.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-03-13T16:34:09.668Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":155,"readers_count":154,"score":71.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":495387,"topic_slug":"teams-how-do-you-tune-auto-align-and-vision-to-competition-fields-particularly-for-reef-alignment","display_username":"Owen Busler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":1737,"username":"Steven_Carmain","name":"Steven Carmain","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/s/f07891/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23320,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/teams-how-do-you-tune-auto-align-and-vision-to-competition-fields-particularly-for-reef-alignment/495387/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3556551,"name":"acastagna","username":"acastagna","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/a/a88e4f/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-13T22:16:42.177Z","cooked":"

we has good results with just pathfind to pose and use a holonomic pid controller only if we are starting too close for pathfind to pose to find a path (about 0.6 meters).

For teams that string together pathfind to pose with a predifnee path or pid controller how do you account for the potential step change in heading between the 2 parts?
